meanings.definition: To disassemble a firearm for cleaning or maintenance.
meanings.sent1: I need to fieldstrip my gun to make sure it's clean.
meanings.sent2: Soldiers often fieldstrip their rifles after training exercises.
meanings.sent3: I tried to fieldstrip my toy gun, but now I can't put it back together!
meanings.sent4: She had to fieldstrip her thoughts to find the root of her anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic showed me how to fieldstrip the engine for a tune-up.

meanings.definition: To dismantle a piece of equipment for inspection or repair.
meanings.sent1: The technician will fieldstrip the computer to fix the issue.
meanings.sent2: It's important to fieldstrip the lawnmower before the mowing season starts.
meanings.sent3: I had to fieldstrip the vacuum cleaner to retrieve the lost earring.
meanings.sent4: She decided to fieldstrip her old habits to make room for new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The engineer had to fieldstrip the machine to identify the faulty component.
